body.p: To His Excellency the Governor of Kentucky.

Your petitioner was fined at the present term of the Franklin Circuit Court the sum of $100 and Six months imprisonment in the county jail upon the charge of unlawfully shooting at without wounding one Thomas Barton. He states that he shot at Barton because he had reasonable grounds to believe that Barton intended to do him or his brother John Griffin great bodily harm. But the witness by whom he could prove that defense could not be found after repeated efforts to do so. Petitioner understood he had left the State ^is now in New orleans^ -- The way in which petitioner happened to be mixed up in the matter was an unprovoked assault of said Barton upon said John Griffin which resulted very nearly in the death of the said John
Petitioner therefore asks that said imprisonment and fine be remitted John Griffin has never entirely recovered from said assault & it is beleived that he will yet die therefrom
Sworn to before me on this 18 Feb /61 --

Jno M Harlan
P J F C C
The undersigned join in the prayer of the petitioner --
